file_content.text: Everything appears stable.
That did it. Analyzer's back online, transmitting the first batch of readings.
Receiving them now. Registering some minor seismic activity, but nothing too alarming.
What do the readings say? Should we start running?
What's wrong?
You think I'm going to fall for that one?
Not funny.
Heh, worth a try.
I hate bad news.
Heh. Gotcha.
I'll be sure to alert command of any impending calamities. And thanks for the help--we'd be blind without you.
I swear I felt something. The sooner you fix that analyzer, the better.
You feel that just now? Like a--a tremor, or something? No?
Sorry, I--it's our geothermic analyzer. Blasted thing's supposed to monitor the local topography, warn us of any anomalies.
Handy if, say, an ice shelf is about to collapse on us. But it's not sending back any readings. Someone's been messing with it.
A system like that could save lives. We need to get it working again.
That's not good.
You're telling me.
I'm not sensing any disturbances. We should be fine for the time being.
We'll be safe for now.
Hey, you've got your... whatever, I've got my analyzer.
You think the Imperials had something to do with this?
You suspect the Empire?
Could be. Or maybe a wampa got its paws on the analyzer. Happened before.
Come on, it's not like a glacier is about to drop on us this second... is it?
You're awfully jumpy.
Well....
Are you going to repair it?
You don't think it was the cold?
Could be the weather.
You don't think it's the cold?
That geothermic analyzer is state of the art. It doesn't get the sniffles.
I sent my boys to patch it up, but they... well, it's been five hours, and the thing's still busted.
I don't like it. Smells like sabotage. Any chance you could scope it out, maybe get that analyzer running again?
Not if it's complicated.
Far as I can tell, it's just the power cells that are damaged. Replacing them's a cinch.
You got it.
Thanks. Should just be the power cells that need replacing. Easy.
I don't know what's out there, but if it got my men... well, it isn't friendly.
You fix it. [Refuse quest]
Don't come crying to me when you get buried under an avalanche.
Come on, come on! Work!
